instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
hi,
this board go in safe mode without tell the battery is under 5%.
now the battery tell 8%
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>= 11,14V
<SIGNAL>PPBAT_G3H</SIGNAL>= 11,14V
the battery is new (say my customer).
i don't know where i check? 
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Green/orange light present? PPBUS with battery disconnected?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Green/orange light is present, PPBU without battery = 12,59V.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
sorry but it's the mode when the battery is too low to work, but always between 8% and 20%
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Sounds like a shit battery to me.
